comments.text: Bump still there, easy to hitchhike. Got direct ride to Mazunte with a sign.
Small bump makes all cars slow down, so they can see you easily. Don't forget to stop by the beach! just a block away.

The panamerican road in general is a very good road to hitchike including Comitán, where I've hitched rides since I was a teenager. But if you are going to El Chiflon waterfalls, be aware that while getting there is quite easy, coming back to Comitán is difficult though.
Got my ride within 3 minutes!
Hardly had time to put my pack down (wbd)

Get a Colectivo from Valladolid to Popola for 15$. From thee you can walk for about 20min through the town and along the highway to the big gas station. you can find rides to Cncun and Merida easily. Was waiting ten minutes till i had a ride to Merida
If you are lucky you can get long rides all along the coast.

Wait at a speed bump for a ride along this road, plenty of tourists coming from La Zona Hotelera will drive you at least to the intersection of highway 307, might even get a ride to a popular tourist destination if you're lucky
Cars are slower here coming through the roundabout so more likely to stop. Pretty low traffic but shouldn't be too tough finding a ride. Amazing guys gave me a ride all the way back to DT Tulum
Caseta de cobro somewhere on this stretch.
Ideal spot. Slow traffic, space to stop.
Great place to catch a ride to Silao. Stood there 5min
With a Tuxtla sign.

There's a traffic light which can be used quite effectively too. Straight non-stop rides to Tuxtla, if going further probably good place to shop around for better ride (highway in Tuxtla can be trickier)
No police checkpoint here as of 2025, walked on to the end of town.

After the police filter you can get car to Bacalar, Chetumal and, even, Palenque.
I wait 2 minutes.
Ride to almost Playa del Carmen
A nice man in a big Pick-Up. N8ce conversion. Ride to Hermosillo.
A nice woman picked me up. A free ride to Creel
Great spor for going either north or south, gas station and covenience stores nearby

High traffic area next to the exit of a large shopping centre, easy to get a ride down south.
-Apr 2025
High traffic area with plenty of space to pull over
Speed bump with bus stop. The drive to Ocosingo takes another three hours or so!
There´s a speed bump here. Got a ride quite quickly with a sign saying Cancun
Kind of a deserted crossroad, might not always be so lucky
Probably the best spot leaving Tulum towards the South, after a speed bump. Quite a lot of traffic, got a few short ride offers before ending up taking the ride all the way where we were going.
Tope. Few private vehicles. Sign helps. If you're going to San Cristóbal, look for a straight ride (or at least to Ocosingo)
Cars come around a sharp corner, but ample stopping space makes up for that.
Take a colectivo to El Porvenir and get off at "la caseta". Checkpoint with Tope
Lots of commercial traffic, got picked up by a pilot. There's a little bay to pull over into
Good place for hiking in direction of Mexico. Cars are going pretty fast but they have time to see you.

There's some buses/colectivos that go to the area around the puente, walk about 200m down the round and there's a hard shoulder where cars can pull over.  Waited about 10 mins for a ride to campeche, but plenty of traffic going further afield too
Pretty good spot for going to Irapuato. Lot's of traffic but cars don't go too fast
Cars coming from Guanajuato slow down to take the exit towards Irapuato.
